answers.answer: Welcome to the Forum.  I'll be glad to comment.  This is not ARS and is not related to HIV.  The timing is too far in the past to be due to acute HIV and the symptoms are not a good match for the ARS..  If you are still concerned about HIV, and it appears that you are, you should get an HIV test to prove that you do not have HIV. when you o, I am confident that you will find that you do not have HIV.  EWH
Okay Doc. That is relief. I plan to get tested once and for all and get this out of my way.Many thanks.

question: To Dr Edward/Hunter,I am returning to this forum after around 3 and half months. On august 3 i posted a question to you about 2-5 "seconds" oral risk with and unknown  HIV status women (she performed) and Dr Edward was very kind enough to allay all my fears and said no need for testing. I did not test.Couple days ago i had a UTI, went to the urgent care.Doc there did a urine routine and said i had UTI. I am a physical therapist and hence started myself on some medications which the doc said continue and added bactrium DS as an antibiotic.had fever 100 and aches with burning urine sensation.I have known to be underweight. However last 6 months i have not put on weight and infact have lost some. i have IBS (had post infective colitis in 03)Long story short.Could this (UTI) be a late symptom of acute hiv? Its been 100 days since the possible exposure.Do i need to be doing HIV testing now or no? I will be getting Diabetes screening done since it runs in my dad's family. I am concerned since i am married.On a side note, i am well informed on the HIV topic since i have read a lot on it in med literature and your forum.Will be glad to hear from you sir!Thanks
title: HIV concern
